title: On Finished and Unfinished Tasks
summary: People remember unfinished or interrupted tasks better than completed ones. The psychological tension of an incomplete task creates a drive to return to it and finish it.

effectiveness_metrics.description: Unfinished tasks remain active in working memory, creating a cognitive 'itch' that motivates resumption.

mechanisms.name: Task Tension
mechanisms.description: The cognitive unease created by an open loop.

mechanisms.name: Closure Drive
mechanisms.description: The natural human desire to resolve tension by completing the task.

mechanisms.name: Interruption Benefit
mechanisms.description: Strategic interruptions can actually increase the likelihood of returning to a task.

actionable_strategies.name: Cliffhanger Protocol
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Encourage users to leave a task 'mid-sentence' or slightly unfinished at the end of a session to make starting the next session easier.

actionable_strategies.name: Open Loop Visuals
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Show a progress circle that is 90% full rather than empty to leverage the desire for visual closure.
